game_physics

Interface CollisionBox

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CoCircle, CoMesh, CoRectangle

    public interface CollisionBox
    The CollisionBox represents the area around the Sprite2D or other game object. If this area intersect with other collision box, user get that information. When user get that information he can decide what he want to do with that object(for example if object collide with wall it stop moving). Collision box can have multiple variants of shape and shape is difference between implementations of this interface. Best way to use Collision box is to add it to Sprite2D or to other game object.
    Author:
    Comexetina
    See Also:
    Sprite2D

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isCollide(CollisionBox otherBox)
      This method check intersection of two object which implements this interface.
      void update(int x, int y)
      This method updating the position of the collision box.

    • Method Detail

      • isCollide

        boolean isCollide(CollisionBox otherBox)
        This method check intersection of two object which implements this interface. Best place to use this method is inside GameWindow.update() because user will get information of intersection in each frame.
        Parameters:
        otherBox - collision box with which we check collision
        Returns:
        true if intersection exist or false if intersection not exist

      • update

        void update(int x,
            int y)
        This method updating the position of the collision box. If Sprite2D or other game object change position his collision box must change position too. Best place to use this method is inside update method of game object which contain this collision box.
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate x of parent object
        y - coordinate y of parrent object
